meanings.definition: A boat used for transporting passengers on water.
meanings.sent1: The waterbus slowly glided across the river, carrying people to the other side.
meanings.sent2: I took the waterbus to get to work this morning instead of the crowded subway.
meanings.sent3: The waterbus driver told a joke to the passengers, making everyone laugh during the ride.
meanings.sent4: The waterbus was a floating taxi, navigating through the busy waterways of the city.
meanings.sent5: The colorful waterbus with its striped awning stood out among the other boats in the harbor.

meanings.definition: A mode of transportation on water that operates like a bus.
meanings.sent1: The waterbus made frequent stops along the canal, picking up and dropping off passengers.
meanings.sent2: During the summer, the waterbus service extended its hours to accommodate the increased tourist traffic.
meanings.sent3: The waterbus driver announced the next stop with a cheerful voice, adding a touch of fun to the journey.
meanings.sent4: As the sun set, the waterbus became a glowing beacon on the darkening river.
meanings.sent5: The waterbus route was a lifeline for the island residents, connecting them to the mainland.
